translated: Questions of King Milinda🔽Questions of the Simile Class🔽The Earth

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘āpassa pañca aṅgāni gahetabbānī’ti yaṁ vadesi, katamāni tāni pañca aṅgāni gahetabbānī”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena āpassa pañca aṅgāni gahetabbāni iti yam vadesi katamāni tāni pañca aṅgāni gahetabbāni iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say five factors of water should be adopted, which are these five factors that should be adopted?”

analyzed: yathā mahā rāja āpaḥ su saṇṭhitam akampitam aluḍita sabhāva parisuddhaḥ
translated: “As, sire, water is well-ordered, unshaken, unagitated, pure in its own nature,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena kuhanalapananemittakanippesikataṁ apanetvā susaṇṭhitamakampitamaluḷitasabhāvaparisuddhācārena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena kuhana lapana nemittaka nippesikatam apanetvā su saṇṭhitam akampitam aluḷita sabhāva parisuddha ācārena
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should, after removing deceit, flattery, hinting, extortion and intimation, be well-ordered, unshaken, unagitated, pure in his own nature in his conduct.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, āpassa paṭhamaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja āpassa paṭhamam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the first factor of water that should be adopted.

analyzed: punar capara mahā rāja āpaḥ sītala sabhā vasaṇṭhitaḥ
translated: “And again, sire, water is cool in its own nature,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena sabbasattesu khantimettānuddayasampannena hitesinā anukampakena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena sabba sattesu khanti mettā anuddaya sampannena hita esinā anukampakena
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be endowed with patience, loving kindness and sympathy towards all beings, be a well-wisher and compassionate.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, āpassa dutiyaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: ida mahā rāja āpassa dutiyam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the second factor of water that should be adopted.”

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, āpo asuciṁ suciṁ karoti;
analyzed: punar capara mahā rāja āpaḥ asucim sucim karoti
translated: “Again, sire, water makes the impure pure;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena gāme vā araññe vā upajjhāye upajjhāyamattesu ācariye ācariyamattesu sabbattha anadhikaraṇena bhavitabbaṁ anavasesakārinā.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena gāme vā araññe vā upajjhāye upajjhāya mattesu ācariye ācariya mattesu sabbattha anadhikaraṇena bhavitabbam anavasesa kārinā
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training, whether in the village or in the forest, should be one who has no dispute with anyone, one who does everything without remainder.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, āpassa tatiyaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja āpassa tatiyam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the third quality of water that must be adopted.

analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja āpaḥ bahu jana patthito
translated: “Again, sire, water is desired by many people;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena appicchasantuṭṭhapavivittapaṭisallānena satataṁ sabbalokamabhipatthitena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena appiccha santuṭṭha pavivitta paṭisallānena satatam sabba lokam abhipatthitena
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should always be desired by all the world because of his fewness of wishes, contentment, aloofness and seclusion.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, āpassa catutthaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: ida mahā rāja āpassa catuttham aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the fourth quality of water that must be adopted.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, āpo na kassaci ahitamupadahati;
analyzed: punar ca para mahā rāja āpaḥ na kassaci ahitam upadahati
translated: “Again, sire, water does no harm to anyone;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena parabhaṇḍanakalahaviggahavivādarittajjhānaaratijananaṁ kāyavacīcittehi pāpakaṁ na karaṇīyaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena para bhaṇḍana kalaha viggaha vivāda ritta jhāna arati jananam kāya vacī cittehi pāpakam na karaṇīya
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should not do anything evil in deed, word or thought that will cause the arising of disputes, quarrels, contentions, disputes in the Sangha, or the breaking of meditation.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, āpassa pañcamaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.🔽Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā, devātidevena kaṇhajātake—🔽‘Varañce me ado sakka,🔽sabbabhūtānamissara;🔽Na mano vā sarīraṁ vā,🔽maṁ-kate sakka kassaci;🔽Kadāci upahaññetha,🔽etaṁ sakka varaṁ vare’”ti.🔽Āpaṅgapañho dutiyo.
analyzed: ida mahā rāja āpassa pañcamam aṅgam 🔽mahā rāja bhagavatā devātidevena kaṇha jātake 🔽varañce me adaḥ sakka 🔽sabba bhūta anamissara 🔽na manaḥ vā sarīram vā 🔽makate sakka kassaci 🔽kadāci upahaññetha 🔽etam sakka varam vara iti 🔽āpaṅga pañhaḥ dutiyo
translated: This, sire, is the fifth quality of water that must be adopted.
